Articles.Content:
G'day everyone (and yes, I really do use that as my usual greeting!).

I have been around a week or so since discovering this ridiculously addictive game.

My name is Johno, and I am in fact a Science teacher (I am seeing this game as a potential learning resource for senior Physics students. That's my excuse for having it on my computer at work, anyhow . . . ). I live in Sydney, Kaustralia.

Love this game, and look forward to helping the devs make it everything it has the potential to be!
Welcome Johno from a fellow Aussie. I think you will find there are quite a few of us here.

G'day Johno,

I think you will find that there are quite a lot of Aussies on these boards. (Myself included)

Welcome and we hope you enjoy your stay

I'm surrounded.

My greeting wouldn't be G'day, more like Howzit, from SA.

Just wanted to say congrats on the Rugby Game yesterday, we deserved that hiding.

Cheers :cheers:

HarbingeR: I have to say I was surprised though.

(Sooooooo not a rugby fan, or a football fan of any other type - cricket is the only sport that matters for anything. )

Johno: Can't say I was, stupid coach with stupid selections.

I don't get Cricket... Play for 5, five, FIVE DAYS and then finish on a draw...
Simple - it's the ultimate sport! What's not to like about a game that is played at such a leisurely pace that you have time for meal breaks?
I guess it is really a gentlemen's game, cant recall ever seeing a fist fight on a pitch, unlike Rugby. Probably because the guys are outnumbered 5 to 1? ;P
